title.native: ラストエグザイル-銀翼のファム-

description:
"I've made up my mind! I'm going to steal that ship!"

All source of life originates from the Grand Lake.

At this very sacred lake, the battle between the Ades Federation and the Turan Kingdom has just begun. The Ades Federation, armed with massive battleships and its sights set on conquering the world, declares war on the Turan Kingdom. With the Federation's troops encroaching on their beloved country, Turan now lies on the brink of collapse. As this is happening, the princesses of Turan look on as a small vanship named Vespa cruises above their heads.

"We shall now commandeer your flagship and take her from this battlefield. The choice is yours. Die here, or survive with us Sky Pirates!"

The Vespa continues to weave through the barrage of bombs, while the fleets of the Federation close in on Turan. What are the motives of Luscinia, the man leading the Ades Federation into the war? And what is the secret behind 'Exile'?

(Source: Animax, edited)
synonyms: Last Exile: Fam the Silver Wing

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

__Favorite Colors:__ Pink, brown
__Hobbies:__ Performing, reading, singing

[Official Website](http://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/sakamotomaaya/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/maayasakamotoCh) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaya_Sakamoto) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9D%82%E6%9C%AC%E7%9C%9F%E7%B6%BE)

Married frequent costar [Kenichi Suzumura](https://anilist.co/staff/95005) on August 8, 2011.

__Favorite Colors:__ Pink, brown
__Hobbies:__ Performing, reading, singing

[Official Website](http://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/sakamotomaaya/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/maayasakamotoCh) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaya_Sakamoto) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9D%82%E6%9C%AC%E7%9C%9F%E7%B6%BE)

Married frequent costar [Kenichi Suzumura](https://anilist.co/staff/95005) on August 8, 2011.

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Doujin Circle:__ PASTA'S ESTAB.

[Website](https://www.pseweb.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Murata_Range)

Renji "Range" Murata is a Japanese artist and designer, known for his unique style combining Art Deco and Japanese Anime elements. He is best known for his conceptual design work on [Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/Last-Exile/) and [Blue Submarine No. 6](https://anilist.co/anime/1051/Blue-Submarine-No-6/).

He began his career in the early 1990s doing design work for video games, including having done the illustrations and character design for the fighting game series made by Atlus, *Power Instinct (豪血寺一族, Goketsuji Ichizoku)*. Since 1996 he left the game company and went on to become a freelance illustrator.

He runs a doujin circle called *PASTA'S ESTAB.*, which publishes collections of illustrations from his various works as well as some original goods. He has published more than a dozen books of his work, some of the most notable being *Robot*, *Rule*, and *futurhythm*. He was also voted "Best Artist of the Year" in the 2006 Seiun Award.

Since 2013 Murata has served as a faculty member at the Kyoto Seika University's Faculty of Manga(Character Design Course). Artist [You Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/105062/You-Shiina) is said to be among his students.

Range Murata selected an elite army of artists including [Yoshitoshi ABe](https://anilist.co/staff/96991/Yoshitoshi-ABe) and [Ugetsu Hakua](https://anilist.co/staff/102066/Ugetsu-Hakua) to contribute to *ROBOT* Volume 1 and ongoing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Power Instinct (Arcade, 1993) (Back Designer) | (SNES, 1994) (Ending Design) *As Range
- Power Instinct 2 (Arcade, 1994) (Scroll Design) *As Range
- Tengai (SEGA Saturn, 1996) (Guest Illustrator)
- Groove on Fight: Gōketsuji Ichizoku 3 (Arcade, 1997) (Designer) *As Range
- Wachenröder (SEGA Saturn, 1998) (Main Character Design)
- Blue Submarine No. 6: Saigetsu Fumahito - Time and Tide (Dreamcast, 2000) (Character Design)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku Tōkon: Matrimelee (Arcade/Neo Geo, 2003) (Illustration)
- Spy Fiction (PlayStation 2, 2003) (Character Designer)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnō no Kaihō (PlayStation 2, 2006) (Illustration)
- Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Senzo Kuyō (Arcade, 2009) (Illustration) !~

[Official Website ](http://kuroishihitomi.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kuroishihitomi) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1FXpihPpl4BxBlfGk3jfjx?autoplay=true)

Hitomi Kuroishi is a Japanese female singer-songwriter and composer, born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture. She is credited simply as "Hitomi" for her vocals, not to be confused with J-pop singer "hitomi". Under Kim Studio (ケイ・アイ・エム; K, I, M). Used to be in 3-person unit Dolce Triade.

[Official Website ](http://kuroishihitomi.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kuroishihitomi) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1FXpihPpl4BxBlfGk3jfjx?autoplay=true)

Hitomi Kuroishi is a Japanese female singer-songwriter and composer, born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture. She is credited simply as "Hitomi" for her vocals, not to be confused with J-pop singer "hitomi". Under Kim Studio (ケイ・アイ・エム; K, I, M). Used to be in 3-person unit Dolce Triade.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bbkoichi21)__
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)
Roba Miyamoto was the winner of the Young Ace Special Award in the first edition of Kadokawa Comics Newcomer Awards in August 2009. His work was titled "Espers of Earth" (地球のエスパーたち).

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.
Debuted as an art director of [Kurau Phantom Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/483/).
Yukio Takahashi is an episode director.
Yukio Takahashi is an episode director.
Yukio Takahashi is an episode director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/618391865)

Makoto Kobayashi is an illustrator, mechanical designer, mangaka, modeller and anime director. He has worked on Kidou Senshi Zeta Gundam and Kidou Senshi Gundam ZZ, one of his more famous creations from there is the RMS-108 Marasai.

Brother of [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/).

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/). Directs on rare occasions.

Worked for Square Enix in Honolulu, Hawaii together with [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and others for the first decade of the 2000s and was completely absent from the anime industry because of this. Returned in 2011 and has been active since.
